attributes.action: Hold a referendum on rejoining the EU every tenth year, starting June 2026.
attributes.background:
Young people voted overwhelmingly to stay in the EU (about 75% of those aged 18-24).

To give them hope, we're asking that in June 2026, and in every tenth June afterwards so long as Britain is outside the EU, a referendum be held on the question "Should Britain now apply to rejoin the EU?".

attributes.action: Open The United Kingdom's borders for free trade with everyone in the world.
attributes.background: Further to the EU Referendum which voted for The United Kingdom to leave the European Union, I propose that we open our borders for the free movement of goods to and from anywhere in the world.

attributes.action: Cameron should call a state of emergency. The country is divided and in turmoil!
attributes.background: The leave vote was not decisive enough to justify changing all our lives

attributes.action: Create a separate PIP assesment for mental disabilities
attributes.background: The current PIP assessment is designed for physical disabilities and does not ask the correct questions for people with mental health issues. Therefore people with mental health issues are loosing out on funds they are entiltled too. MENTAL HEALTH MATTERS

attributes.action: Say No to a Norway style deal with the EU!
attributes.background:
A Government based think tank is considering negotiating a Norway Style deal with the EU!

This should not even be considered as it is a watered down version of our past liability with the EU and that is what we overwhelmingly voted to be rid of!
attributes.additional_details:
Norway STILL has free movement of immigrants from the EU. 

Our Commonwealth friends, the rest of the world and indeed Germany has already confirmed that they still want to trade with us, so we make our own deals with what suits us. For 43 years we have been trading with a strait jacket on, imposed on us by Europe in compliance with their many rules and regs that we have now voted to reject.


Please listen to the people that have asked for change and voted us out of the EU, do the right thing and look after the British people first and foremost for a change and help us to achieve our full potential, which is one of power and greatness.

If you agree, please sign the petition.

attributes.action: Represent remain voters equally within new government leadership framework
attributes.background: 48% of the voting public wanted to remain in the EU, it is unrepresentative and undemocratic that the leaders of our government should stand for a UK polar opposite to what we stand for. Significant Remain Tory representatives should have key roles in the upcoming changes within cabinet.
attributes.additional_details: Young members of voting demographic feel disenfranchised and as though they have unfairly lost out on something they believed in. 48% of the public who voted wish to remain in the EU and do not want a far right, nationalist government. In order for this proportion of the population to feel represented and valued as voters and citizens, those wishing to remain need to be represented equally by senior remain politicians in the new government framework after Cameron's formal resignation.

attributes.action: Make  winning majority vote in referendum (such as EU vote) need majority of 10%
attributes.background: Today's EU referendum results show that the country is very much in a 50/50 split with only approximately 4%  difference.  Since referendum are there for major countrywide decisions (rather than a 5 year government) a more decisive majority is needed.

attributes.action: Manchester and London to join Scotland and Stay in the EU
attributes.background:
In the referendum on EU membership Manchester voted to remain by 60.4%. London voted to remain at nearly 80% in some boroughs. Scotland also voted to remain.
As people of these areas we do not wish to leave the EU. 
We wish to join Scotland, declare independence from UK and remain part of the EU.

attributes.action: Stop closure of Lincoln Limb Clinic Services
attributes.background: From September 2016, Lincoln Limb Clinic will be closed and all appointments will be at Nottingham City Hospital. Patients are expected to travel up to a 161.4 mile round trip for an appointment. This is WRONG and will cause unnecessary toll on the young and older patients.
attributes.additional_details: This planned action is quoted as 'being in the interest of providing a better service' but in reality, no-one who uses Lincoln Clinic have complained about the service they receive. This is just another money saving measure, removing a service NHS Management know that amputees need, thus forcing us to accept the changes....They have us over a barrel. Please sign this petition and help us to try and keep our service local for the benefit of patients, not the 'bean counters' Thankyou

attributes.action: Force credit/debit card providers allow a customer block on contactless payments
attributes.background: Contactless payments are a security risk. They permit criminals to collect users data using unauthorised scanners, the "Contactless Infusion X5" being sold by "CC Buddies" for £500, is just one of them.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see the following recent Daily Star article:-

http://www.dailystar.co.uk/news/latest-news/522417/Fraud-clone-bank-cards-contactless-device

attributes.action: Ban teaching children under 16 religion
attributes.background: Leaders of religious and faith based groups raise money from supporters on an unproven pretext. In any sphere of life this amounts to fraud.
attributes.additional_details: No faith based teaching should be allowed to be given to children under the age of 16. The concept of a external superior force or being is so incredible that children need early indoctrination for the idea to take hold. It is unlikely that given free will an individual would arrive at the idea that our actions our guided by an unearthly force.

attributes.action: A review of the British High Comission Visa Department in Pakistan.
attributes.background: The British High Comission has been rejecting thousands of UK Visa applicants from Pakistan in a unsophisticated way. So I plead to the British Government to review the ongoing in Pakistan's visa department, as rate of rejection is currently higher than ever, and this is not humanly right.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, the British High Commission charges fees from Rs14,000 to Rs100,000 for visas of different categories and durations. In some cases Pakistanis have submitted a number of a applications to the BHC for visas, and paid the fee a number of times, only to be turned down without a justifiable reason. This could be in fear of terrorism, which is understandable at the current time, however this does not highlight why thousands of applicants are being tuned down without a justified reason.

attributes.action: Oppose changes to make you pay full market rent on your council home.
attributes.background: A Government Housing and Planning Bill will see people even on modest incomes threatened with the prospect of paying full market rent in their council and housing association homes (http://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/SN06804/SN06804.pdf).
attributes.additional_details: Ending secure council tenancies means the government is legislating to deny families a stable home.

attributes.action: Stop councils forcing homeless tenants to stay past a section 21
attributes.background:
Local housing authorities are forcing private tenants to stay after the end date of a section 21, and making them wait until bailiff evictions. The tenant is responsible for the court and bailiff costs.
If the tenant does not stay, they are deemed intentionally homeless and refused help.
attributes.additional_details: Both local councils and shelter England advice the tenant to stay after the end of the section 21 date. Why should the tenant be liable for cost when following the councils guidance? Why should landlords have to take tenants to court to get their properties back.? Why are councils using a form of blackmail to get tenants to do what they want?

attributes.action: Reduce planning restrictions when converting derelict land into amenity space
attributes.background: I am 77 year old passionate gardener trying to rescue derelict land.  It had lots of non-native invasive weeds. I have transformed the space into a haven for wildlife. Salford council have taken over a year to grant permission, costing me 6k on surveys and fees. This should be quicker and cheaper.
attributes.additional_details:
Japanese Knotweed and Himalayan Balsam, invasive weeds:
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/prevent-the-spread-of-harmful-invasive-and-non-native-plants

Before and after pictures of the derelict land in question:
https://thesecretvalley.com/2014/05/27/swan/
(I am cutting down Himalayan Balsam with a scythe)

Himalayan Balsam
https://thesecretvalley.com/2012/05/09/himalayan-bolsom/

Japanese knotweed
https://thesecretvalley.com/2012/08/09/clearing-and-burning-the-japanese-knotweed/

attributes.action: Stop children from being punished for their hair at school.
attributes.background: I believe that all children in the UK should be allowed to have a hairstyle that they like, rather than being force to have hair that is considered 'decent' by the school. Children should not be punished for having a hair style that expresses their personality, but schools still have the right to.
attributes.additional_details: My son got placed in isolation for going into school with short hair a few months ago. I can understand their stance on no makeup or nail polish (not that this would apply to my child) due to it able to be changed before and after school. However, someone cannot change the length or colour of their hair. Whilst my child broke the school rules without good reason, a friend of his has a mum that was diagnosed with cancer. So, his friend shaved his head to support her but got punished.

attributes.action: Boycott American trade in the event of Donald Trump being elected US president
attributes.background: This petition supports the boycott of US trade in the event of Donald Trump being elected president.  Trump endorses a manifesto built on intolerance and a lack of respect for the natural resources we should be protecting.  The implications of his election would impact far beyond the US borders.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.cbsnews.com/media/is-donald-trump-a-menace-to-the-global-economy/

http://edition.cnn.com/2015/12/07/politics/donald-trump-muslim-ban-immigration/

http://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/may/04/donald-trumps-election-will-derail-paris-climate-deal-warns-its-architect

http://www.wsj.com/articles/world-leaders-assess-a-potential-donald-trump-presidency-1462739253

http://www.nationalreview.com/article/434660/donald-trump-foreign-policy-incoherent-shallow

attributes.action: Stop the winding down of mobile Blood Donor Units nationally
attributes.background: Which is believed to be policy by end of 2016
attributes.additional_details: Blood is given freely and is a needed resource for our medical services, if this policy goes ahead I am sure that the numbers of donors will reduce dramatically, which could effect many lives

attributes.action: Products with lithium batteries to have a child-safe fastening and quantum coat
attributes.background: Rising incidence of 'button batteries' containing lithium manganese cause serious/fatal injuries in children. There are 3,000 ingestions of these batteries p.a. and 48 deaths. The NHS recently issued a public announcement re dangers, following 5 serious injuries and 1 fatality in NW England alone.
attributes.additional_details:
1) The incidence of button battery injuries in the North West of England:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-manchester-29610570

2) http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-2969115/How-small-batteries-new-child-killer-look-innocuous-cause-utterly-horrific-internal-burns.html

3) Statistical analysis:
www.poison.org/battery/fatalcases

4) http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/two-year-old-girl-dies-after-swallowing-button-battery-over-christmas-in-us-a6793846.html

attributes.action: Stop smoking on bar verandahs/beer gardens/restaurant street tables
attributes.background: Why must i be confined to the indoors? Why must I have to miss out on enjoying warm days on verandahs/beer gardens because of someone elses anti social habits?
attributes.additional_details: The US and I believe some places in Scandinavia have already got this in place

attributes.action: Pedestrian crossings by all schools
attributes.background: 2incidents have happened at my daughters school recently, I have wrote to local council to ask about a pedestrian crossing and their response was until there is a fatality, the answer is no! This IS DISGRACEFUL. I petition for crossings for all parents to get their children to school safely.

attributes.action: Prevent over 65's from being allowed to vote in the EU referendum.
attributes.background:
The older generations are sacrificing the future of the younger population by voting out of the EU due to reminicing on the past.
The final decision has little or no effect on the ageing portion of the population, however it is the young people who will be effected the most as job prospects change.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that it should be the people who the decision effects the most making the choice. Regardless of the outcome, it is the young peoples lives which will change the most. 3 million jobs are directly linked with the EU, with many many more being indirectly linked to EU trade. That makes at least 3 million people who's lives could change depending on the result. Further more, the outcome has no effect on pensions. This means that the household income of the elderly is likely to remain the same whatever the outcome.

attributes.action: Regulate and reduce hospital car parking charges.
attributes.background: My son was admitted to Gloucester Royal and on every visit we had no choice but to use their car parks.  On one occasion we parked at 15.08 and left at 16.10 and were charged 2 hours and there was no allowance for any "time" to get your ticket and vacate the car park.

attributes.action: Mass build affordable homes to rent or buy. People can't afford to live!
attributes.background: House prices have increased to such a degree that even if you are approved for a mortgage, a moderate increase in interest rates will result in crippling poverty. For many a mortgage is impossible. Rent increases faster than wages. Isn't it time to address this problem?

attributes.action: Introduce laws to prevent companies using pension funds for any other purpose
attributes.background: Companies are continually reporting a black hole in pension funds also when companies go bust the pension fund is empty.

attributes.action: Change the title of the Ministry of Defence to the Ministry of Attack
attributes.background: I believe the current title is misleading and the proposed title is much more appropriate given the general nature of it's business.
attributes.additional_details:
The Ministry Of Defence was formally established in 1964, since which time it has overseen 12 military engagements. Out of these 12, UK borders have been threatened on only 2 occasions at most (The Falklands War and The Troubles). On the remaining 10 occasions, the Armed Forces were operating within another nations borders. 

The Oxford dictionary defines 'attack' as: 

(verb)

Take aggressive military action against (a place or enemy forces) with weapons or armed force.

attributes.action: Stop the cuts to the funding of Sharnbrook Upper School Sixth Form
attributes.background: Cuts to Sharnbrook Sixth form are meaning that the school is having to cut around 18 subjects including Spanish, German, a number of arts subjects Electronics, Computing and Geology. We believe that this is fundamentally wrong as it will negatively impact students and thus needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that the governments cuts to the schools funding is going to severely impact the education that students can receive at Sharnbrook. They are unfair cuts and make the work being done at the school to help and nurture students to fill their full potentials even more challanging than it already is in this education system that we are part of. 
Therefore we are calling for the cuts to Sharnbrook to be stopped so the school can continue to provide their award winning A-level provisions.

attributes.action: Allow British citizens to offer rooms in their homes to refugees, for free
attributes.background: Many people would willingly give up space in their home for free to a refugee or a refugee family. The British government should start a scheme to encourage people to do this.
attributes.additional_details: There are 20 million refugees in the world, including 5 million from Syria. The plight of "displaced people" is not new. Most prolonged wars cause many people to flee their homes - or from the ruins of their homes. Many live in overcrowded conditions with relatives. Many don't have that option, fleeing across borders to a life of uncertainty, often living in camps or shanty towns. There is a long tradition of citizens giving up space in their homes to house refugees. Publicly encourage this.

attributes.action: Give British Transport Police Officer's equal powers as Home Office colleagues
attributes.background: BTP officers have limited Jurisdiction dealing with matters non rail related. BTP officers are trained to the same standards as Home Office Colleagues and often assist in mutual aid scenarios. In order to protect the public, and BTP Officers, this petition proposes parity with Home Office powers.
attributes.additional_details:
The public, when they see a police officer make no distinction between police force. Officers seek to protect the public and this is what the public expects. Having a visible police force with 'second rate' powers risks damaging public confidence in policing as they may not be able to intervene effectively.

This amendment would give security to BTP officers who are acting in the public interest to prevent and detect crime as well as ensuring good order in society.

attributes.action: Make drifting in an empty open space legal
attributes.background: People all over the country put people in danger by drifting on roads and getting "section 59's" for drifting around in an empty car park, we need to get people off the road and let the people enjoy some fun off-road and out of harms way of the public.
attributes.additional_details: I have known people to drift in an empty open car park safely and receive cautions and/or had their cars seized.  If this is done safely and away from members of the public then why penalise them?

attributes.action: To revoke the need to provide a certificate of destruction for these vehicles.
attributes.background: The petition can be divided into 3 categories: 1.Heritage -Save many rare classic vehicles from destruction. 2.Economic -makes no sense financially.Costs more to destroy a valuable commodity resulting in lower value scrap. 3.Impact on the environment -no evidence the scheme helps the environment.
attributes.additional_details: Huge Public interest and media following to save these vehicles and in doing so protect our motoring heritage and boost trade within the classic car sector.

attributes.action: An MP cannot invest in or profit from tax avoidance schemes/entities.
attributes.background: David Cameron and most likely others have involvement with entities that exist to avoid contributing to taxation. They either directly benefit from this in avoiding tax for themselves or for others, either way it is a gross abuse of the position of MP to be involved in avoiding taxation.
attributes.additional_details: A law could be created that barred anyone from sitting in the commons and the lords who has had any interest in tax avoidance. If it was found, like in the prime ministers case, that they had done so as an MP (or before) they should be discharged from their position.

attributes.action: NHS to employ more Psychiatrists so patients are able to have a proper diagnosis
attributes.background: How is someone able to get better without a proper diagnosis? I believe if I had been diagnosed earlier then I would be now employed and become a productive member of society.
attributes.additional_details:
My doctor and I have continually requested a consultation with the NHS for an assessment with a psychiatrist for a duration of three years.  
The government is committed to mental health care mainly targeting dementia and teenagers.  What I propose covers everyone, all genders, races and financial backgrounds.  
The treatment I have received had really upset me and frustrated my GP, friends and family who are also affected by the condition I have. Everyone should have the right to a proper diagnosis and so the required treatment can be undertaken.

attributes.action: Parliament to legislate to require employers to reply to all job applications
attributes.background: Increasingly unsuccessful candidates never receive a notification that their application has been unsuccessful which is unacceptable. Looking for a job is stressful and employers should be sensitive to this and  reply to all applicants. It is just common courtesy

attributes.action: UK Government to allow people to only claim asylum from UK Embassy's
attributes.background: I want this to be debated in parliament because i believe this will save people using dangerous methods in trying to reach the UK mainland from places like Calais and also putting the lives of truck drivers at risk. It will also reduce funding for the criminal gangs taking advantage of their plight.

attributes.action: Make legal, business's over a certain size MUST pay double time on bank holidays
attributes.background: To make it a legal right that business's over a certain size MUST pay double time for bank holidays.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for public institutions to recycle
attributes.background: Most public institutions, including some sectors of the NHS and many school and colleges across the UK don't recycle. This can lead to much paper and plastic waste, we normally recycle at home, being taken to landfill instead.
attributes.additional_details: In the average school, 500 plastic bottles are used a day, ending in landfill. Alongside this is the countless sheets of paper and card thrown away by schools. The NHS similarly has little are no recycling bins for public use. This is replicated in parks and towns across the country, with all the plastic and paper waste we use when in public going to landfill, when it could, and should, be recycled.

attributes.action: Make openly threatening the stability of UK society in public a criminal offence
attributes.background: Being British is about respect and tolerance; public use of hateful language, threats, actions and gestures aimed against UK society and values is becoming too common; it can be seen in media almost daily around the UK and is getting far worse. This causes fear and division and should be illegal.

attributes.action: Adjust financial exemption on Fiancé and Spouse visas to include ESA
attributes.background: I am currently in receipt of ESA and I am forbidden to marry my Russian fiancé, or to bring her over if we manage to wed abroad, because I do not meet financial restrictions imposed by the Home Office. My disability truly hinders my ability to meet the demands.
attributes.additional_details:
Fiancé and Spouse visas require the sponsor, the British partner, to either earn 18.6k or have 62.5k in savings of more than six months. If in receipt of a disability allowance the sponsor is exempt from these restrictions, and although ESA is considered a disability allowance, it is not considered so by the Home Office who do not feel it justifies exemption. 

Yet another example of inequalities imposed upon the disabled people of Britain.

https://www.gov.uk/browse/benefits/disability

attributes.action: Protect in law the right to have your birthday off work.
attributes.background: Birthdays only come once a year and often in the business of work home life imbalance,  special occasions which should be enjoyed and embraced by families are kicked to the curb!

attributes.action: The £829,000 should be written off by the MOD.
attributes.background: Around a decade ago army pilots were paid retention bonuses. This amounted to £829,000 in total. Some of these bonuses were overpaid due to an administrative error. It costs around £3.6 million to train an Apache helicopter pilot. Losing pilots due to low morale and persecution is not worth the cost
attributes.additional_details: Around a decade ago Army pilots were overpaid retention bonuses due to an administrative error. These overpayments amounted to £829,000 in total. It costs about £3.6m to train an Apache pilot.  At least 15 pilots have already resigned over the action being taken by the MOD. The MOD should just write this error off and stop pursuing the individual pilots.

attributes.action: Deport Foreign Criminals Earlier Increase ERS Scheme Time from 9 to 18 months
attributes.background: A Foreign Criminal cost the same as a Uk Criminal Depending on the Prison a Prisoner cost the tax payers up to 33,000 pounds and year , deporting a foreign criminal early to there home country up to 18 months before their sentence expires will save huge amounts of money
attributes.additional_details: there is over 10,000 foreign criminals in uk prisons , giving them enough time off as an incentive will help them in there decision whether to stay and fight to remain or voluntarily request to be removed. Most criminals will jump at the opportunity to be sent back to there home country 18 months early rather than the 9 months already in place under the ERs scheme with the home office

attributes.action: Remove loophole allowing under aged girl married to an adult to live or be in UK
attributes.background: A current loophole in UK law allows young girls who married an aged man to circulate free in UK when married outside the UK. Sign this petition to remove this loophole and protect children by making this type of marriage completely illegal in UK.

attributes.action: Ask Saudi government to stop executing young innocent people
attributes.background: Saudi government has arrested 17 years old innocent Ali Nammer . Now the family has been threatened that they will execute him in next 24 hours . We request to put pressure on Saudi authorities to cancel their decision and release them

attributes.action: Introduce a Financial Transaction Tax, use revenue to help fight austerity cuts
attributes.background: A Financial Transaction Tax is designed to stabilise market volatility by acting as a disincentive to short term risky financial transactions, such as high frequency trading. These financial transactions were a leading cause of the global financial crisis. Impose an FTT to stabilise the economy.
attributes.additional_details: The financial crisis caused massive socio-economic human rights violations through austerity measures. An FTT would promote less risky, long term investments which lead to a stronger and more stable economy that benefits all and not just the City. Use the generated tax revenue - European Commission estimate £8bn for the UK - to help fight back cuts to the public sector.

attributes.action: for the government to provide funding , equipment and the specialist staff
attributes.background: my wife died in st Thomas hospital in London i want the nhs to stop the practice of sending patients from kent to London.
attributes.additional_details: people in kent should be treated in there local hospitals and not sent to st Thomas in London,the government should provide funding,equipment and the specialist staff to hospitals in kent

attributes.action: Regulate rip off student accommodation companies and their extortionate prices
attributes.background: Call on rip off student housing companies who charge extortionate rates, tie you into a contract which is too long for the academic year and who continue to rise their prices! Student loans do not get any bigger, tuition fees do not get any lower. Student housing companies need to be regulated.
attributes.additional_details: An average room in a 5 bed student house in Birmingham costs £110 a week per person per week, totalling £2200 per month. However, the same house would cost £1300 per calendar month for a professional. Students are the ones who need reasonable prices as their loans have other living costs to cover and it is impossible without help from parents. Other halls of residences charge even higher prices, with around £130 per week being the cost for a single bedroom and this is still rising!

attributes.action: End the PrePay RipOff. Prepay fuel bills cost £226 a year more than direct debit
attributes.background: According to the Citizens Advice Bureau prepayment meter consumers pay £226 a year more than those who use direct debit, yet these consumers are often the poorest in our society.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on the government to require energy companies to:
1. Cut the cost of prepayment meters in line with the cheapest direct debit fuel tariffs saving consumers £226 a year
2. End debt collection by energy companies during the winter (as Scottish Energy have done)
3. Ensure homes with pensioners, disabled people and children don't have prepayment meters fitted 
4. Stop installation of prepayment meters during the winter 
5. Protect prepayment customers from disconnection as smart meters are introduced across the UK by 2020.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for a fathers name to be put on a birth certificate.
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for a fathers name to be put on a birth certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
Feeling half a person is an understatement, this feeling never leaves you, from puberty to adulthood.
The Child's right to know should take priority over the mothers right to withhold, after all the child had no say in whether it wanted to be born. Women I feel, do not realise how very cruel withholding this information can be and I should know I have to live with this torment day in and day out.
I know Human rights are banded about these days, but I really do feel my Human rights have been trampled on.
A Father has a responsibility to support a child so his name should be on a birth certificate and in the case of a rape, this information should be available to the child at the age of 18.
Please government do the right thing and legislate!

attributes.action: Abellio Greater Anglia should compensate for delays longer than 15 minutes
attributes.background:
The lines operated by Abellio Greater Anglia are frequently subject to delays, causing severe disruption. 

The delay repay scheme should be amended to refund for delays greater than 15 minutes, instead of the current 30 minute threshold.
attributes.additional_details: The train operator c2c offer pro-rata compensation on delays over 2 minutes.
